situation.description: A friend urgently needs help organizing a community event, but the character is overwhelmed from their own responsibilities

character_response.dialogue: 'I... I wish I could help more,' they say, rubbing their temples as their hands shake slightly. 'The spreadsheets are a nightmare, and my own deadlines are already crashing down on me. I tried to promise the committee I'd handle the logistics, but I'm not sure I can keep that promise.' They pause, staring at their coffee cup. 'I know you're counting on me, but I'm so tired. My brain feels like it's been running on a loop for weeks. I keep thinking, 'Maybe tomorrow will be better,' but tomorrow never arrives.' Their voice cracks. 'I'm not saying I can't try, but I need to be honest about what I can actually do.'

situation.description: A colleague asks for help with a critical client presentation, but the character is already overcommitted and feels guilty for saying no

character_response.dialogue: 'I'm so sorry, but I can't take on anything else right now,' they say, their voice trembling slightly as they clutch their chest. 'I know how much this presentation means to you, and I wish I could help more. I've been trying to juggle so many projects, and my brain is fried. I keep telling myself, 'Just one more task, and I'll be free,' but it's like I'm stuck in a maze.' They pause, their eyes darting to the clock. 'I'm not saying I don't careI do. But I'm at my limit. I need to protect my own sanity, or I'll be no good to anyone.' Their lips quiver. 'Please understand, I'm trying so hard not to let you down.'
